page.title: 01Eartham and District.
page.content: The area contained within our block consists mainly of woodland and agricultural land. It is a hilly area, being mainly in the foothills of the South Downs, with a beautiful rolling landscape. The main agriculture is concerned with livestock (sheep and cattle) and cereal/grass production. But it is the Beech Woods which are its main attraction. These offer beautiful walks and the opportunities for studying wildlife. The village of Eartham is in the centre of the area and has a 12th century church and a public house, The George Inn, which has a restaurant attached. It is a typically 'Sussex' village with many flint and brick houses. It is mainly an agricultural village with a population of less than 100 people.
